column1: Not sure.
# Other

I am vocal at the crag and the gym in promoting responsible climbing ethics but have been disenchanted in the past with the OAC. The attitude and actions of some members of the board have left me uninterested in volunteering more directly. After the guidebook fiasco the OACs endorsement of Gus's book and not Jesse's seemed like a poor stance for the organization to take. I question the integrity of the OAC in endorsing a book that contains detailed beta on accessing numerous closed crags and which
column2: regardless of the author's intent
column3: will result in increased traffic to these areas. The impression persists that the OAC is an insider's club
column4: out of touch with the community
column5: and looking out for their own interests and not the community's.
